problem_summary: Deployment viability for production use. Achieving >70% on SWE-Bench-Bash-Only with GraniteTiny requires not just raw accuracy, but a solution that scales reliably, integrates cleanly with existing systems, and delivers measurable business value. The path from research prototype to production adoption depends on these three pillars working together.
reasoning: A solution that integrates cleanly, scales well, and delivers business value will see production adoption. This is the path from research to real-world impact. GraniteTiny's tiny footprint (1.3B parameters) makes it ideal for local deployment, but success requires: (1) Scalable architecture that handles concurrent requests without degradation, (2) Clean integration with CI/CD pipelines and existing tools, (3) Clear business case demonstrating ROI vs cloud alternatives ($0 local vs $200+ cloud per benchmark run).

gaps: Rate limiting needs refinement for high-concurrency scenarios

evidence: OpenAI-compatible provider pattern (LM Studio, Ollama, cloud APIs)
CLI interface with rich output formatting
gaps: CI/CD pipeline templates not yet created

evidence: Cost analysis framework ($0 local vs $X cloud)

solution_steps.title: Package as pip-installable library
solution_steps.description: Make Conjecture easily installable and distributable
solution_steps.scalability_aspect: Enables distributed deployment across multiple machines
solution_steps.integration_aspect: Standard Python packaging allows integration with any Python project
solution_steps.business_aspect: Reduces adoption friction; users can 'pip install conjecture' and start using
implementation: Create setup.py with proper dependencies and entry points
Publish to PyPI (Python Package Index)
Document installation for different platforms (Windows, macOS, Linux)
Provide quick-start guide for new users
Include version management and upgrade path
success_criteria: Installation works on Windows, macOS, Linux
Entry points work correctly (conjecture command available)

solution_steps.title: Support CI/CD integration
solution_steps.description: Enable automated testing and deployment workflows
solution_steps.scalability_aspect: Automated testing ensures quality at scale; prevents regressions
solution_steps.integration_aspect: Works with GitHub Actions, GitLab CI, Jenkins, CircleCI, etc.
solution_steps.business_aspect: Reduces manual testing overhead; enables continuous delivery
implementation: Create GitHub Actions workflow templates (.github/workflows/)
Provide GitLab CI configuration (.gitlab-ci.yml)
Document Jenkins pipeline setup
Include pre-commit hooks for code quality
Add automated test reporting and coverage tracking
success_criteria: GitHub Actions workflow runs tests on every push

Include health checks and graceful shutdown

solution_steps.title: Provide support and maintenance plan

scalability.measurement: Load testing results, response time under load

integration.measurement: Integration test pass rate, deployment success rate

conclusion.summary: Achieving >70% on SWE-Bench-Bash-Only with GraniteTiny requires combining scalability (handling production load), integration (seamless deployment), and business value (clear ROI). The infrastructure is production-ready; success depends on professional packaging, deployment automation, and clear communication of value.
conclusion.key_insight: Success is not just about accuracy—it's about making the solution so easy to deploy and integrate that adoption becomes inevitable. Scalability + Integration + Business = Production Adoption.
